author: Zach Schonfeld
description: Chief Justice John Roberts used his previous two annual reports to condemn politicians for intimidating judges and warn about artificial intelligence.  This year, Roberts steered clear of current affairs.  His 2025 Year End Report on the Judiciary, released Wednesday evening, makes no mention of the tensions that have grown in the judiciary over the Supreme Court’s emergency decisions implicating President Trump’s second-term agenda.  Instead, Roberts opted to fill his report with reflections on the Declaration of Independence. As the declaration’s 250th anniversary approaches next year, Roberts detailed how the…
title: Roberts avoids clashes with Trump in end-of-year judiciary report

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Billionaire and California gubernatorial candidate Tom Steyer (D) on Tuesday said the United States needs a single-payer health care system. “Bernie Sanders was right. We need single-payer health care,” Steyer said in a video shared on social media. “In 2019, I didn’t think we needed single-payer health care.” Steyer said he thought the U.S. could…
title: Tom Steyer: ‘We need single-payer health care’

author: Filip Timotija
description: The U.S. military conducted strikes against a convoy of alleged drug-trafficking boats in the U.S. Southern Command (Southcom) area of responsibility, killing three “narco-terrorists” and leaving multiple survivors after others jumped overboard.   The U.S. military targeted three purported drug-smuggling vessels on Tuesday, which were operated by a designated terrorist organization and were transiting in international…
title: Strike on ‘narco-trafficking’ boat convoy kills 3; Coast Guard notified

author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump’s administration is ramping up pressure against Venezuela’s oil trade, sanctioning four companies operating in the country’s oil industry, along with four tankers connected to the firms. The Treasury Department on Wednesday said it slapped sanctions on four companies with ties to Caracas’ oil sector: Aries Global Investment LTD, Winky International Limited, Krape Myrtle…
title: Trump administration ramps up sanctions targeting Venezuela oil trade

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson (D) on Tuesday slammed President Trump for not providing “hope” to working people in the Windy City or across the country. “We know that this president has failed in every single aspect to provide real opportunities and hope for working people. Whether it’s, you know, groceries, whether it’s health care, whether…
title: Chicago mayor: Trump has failed to provide ‘hope for working people’

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Former special counsel Jack Smith was still contemplating whether to charge President Trump’s co-conspirators in the Jan. 6, 2021, case when the president won the election, he revealed to the House in a closed-door deposition released Wednesday. Smith also told investigators he was preparing to rely on a number of Trump allies who agreed to…
title: Jack Smith deposition reveals plans for trial, possible charges against co-conspirators

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Colorado Democratic Sens. Michael Bennet and John Hickenlooper on Wednesday slammed President Trump for vetoing a bill aiming to complete a water project in the Centennial State. The president issued the first two vetoes of his second term, one of which blocked a project that would have delivered water to southeastern Colorado. “Nothing says ‘Make…
title: Colorado Democrats rip Trump over water bill veto: ‘Politics at its worst’

author: The Hill Staff
description: House Judiciary Committee Chair Jim Jordan (R-Ohio) on Wednesday released the transcript of the panel’s deposition with former special counsel Jack Smith concerning his team’s investigations and prosecutions of President Trump. Earlier this month, Smith’s attorneys sent a letter to Jordan requesting that his closed-door deposition be made public. In the testimony, Smith defended his decision to bring charges against Trump…
title: Read: Jack Smith deposition transcript

author: Tara Suter
description: A CNN reporter pressed YouTuber Nick Shirley in a segment that aired Tuesday night over his viral video in which he visits Minnesota day care facilities run by the Somali community, which he accuses of fraud. In the video, shared by Elon Musk and Vice President Vance this week, Shirley knocks on doors at various…
title: CNN reporter grills YouTuber whose Minnesota day care video went viral

author: Max Rego
description: The Department of Justice (DOJ) still has 5.2 million pages of files to review in the case of the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, Reuters reported Wednesday. The Epstein Files Transparency Act, passed by Congress and signed into law by President Trump, set a Dec. 19 deadline for the DOJ to release all documents…
title: DOJ still reviewing 5.2M pages of Epstein files: Report

author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Lauren Boebert (R-Colo.) is voicing frustration with President Trump over his recent veto of legislation that intended to finish a project for sending water to Southeastern Colorado. “This isn’t over,” Boebert posted on the social platform X late Tuesday in response to Trump’s veto, one of the first of his second term. In a…
title: Boebert criticizes Trump veto, hopes it is not about ‘political retaliation’

author: Nancy Altman, opinion contributor
description: Donald Trump is attempting to demolish the Wilbur J. Cohen Federal Building, which contains the famous Social Security mural, while also enacting policies that threaten the Social Security system itself.
title: Donald Trump’s year of Social Security sabotage

author: Max Rego
description: Rep. James Comer (R-Ky.), the chair of the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee, announced Wednesday that the body will hold hearings on fraud concerns within Minnesota’s social services programs in the new year. The first hearing is set for Jan. 7, with state Reps. Kristin Robbins (R), Walter Hudson (R) and Marion Rarick (R)…
title: Comer announces hearings on Minnesota fraud

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Actor George Clooney took a shot at CBS and ABC, two broadcast networks that have both settled high-profile lawsuits brought by President Trump in recent months. “If CBS and ABC had challenged those lawsuits and said, ‘Go f‑‑‑ yourself,’ we wouldn’t be where we are in the country,” Clooney, who recently became a citizen of…
title: George Clooney rips CBS, ABC for settling Trump defamation suits

author: Former Rep. Steve Israel (D-N.Y.), opinion contributor
description: Members of Congress have shared their favorite books of the year, ranging from biographies to children's books to books on art and intelligence, showing that books provide a bipartisan connection and that policymakers continue to rely on them for guidance.
title: Book recommendations from members of Congress

author: Tara Suter
description: President Trump claimed Tuesday that his “real” approval rating is at 64 percent, despite polls showing it is below 50 percent. “The polls are rigged even more than the writers,” Trump said in a late-night Truth Social post. “The real number is 64%, and why not, our Country is ‘hotter’ than ever before.” He added,…
title: Trump claims his ‘real’ approval rating is 64 percent

author: Rachel Frazin
description: President Trump issued two vetoes this week, the first of his second term, rejecting two bipartisan bills, at least one of which is making waves within his party. Trump vetoed legislation that aimed to complete a project that would deliver water to southeastern Colorado and another that would give the Miccosukee tribe the authority to manage part of the…
title: Trump issues first vetoes of his 2nd term, rejecting Colorado water project and Florida tribal bill

author: Sheldon Jacobson, opinion contributor
description: All speech today is filtered.  The key difference is what the filters are.
title: Free speech needs a reset in America

author: Max Rego
description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said Wednesday that the Trump administration is reviewing cases for denaturalization of U.S. citizens who came to the country from Somalia and were convicted of fraud in the Minnesota social services controversy.  Leavitt said on “Fox and Friends” that the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the State Department…
title: Trump administration ‘looking at’ revoking citizenship of Somali Americans caught up in fraud scheme: Leavitt

author: The Hill Staff
description: The Trump administration has turned its focus to a years-long fraud scandal in Minnesota, expanding the federal government’s presence in the state, as 2025 draws to a close. Several agencies, including the Department of Health and Human Services, Small Business Administration, Department of Homeland Security and Justice Department, have taken action since a viral video…
title: Live updates: Walz pushes back as Trump ups pressure over Minnesota fraud scandal

author: Jos Joseph, opinion contributor
description: Middle-class and working-class Trump voters are beginning to question their support for the MAGA movement as they face economic hardship and the Trump administration's policies have not delivered the promised benefits.
title: Trump Derangement Syndrome changed definitions in 2025

author: Max Rego
description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) slammed the Trump administration for pausing child care payments to his state amid increased federal scrutiny of alleged fraud within its social services programs.  “This is Trump’s long game,” Walz wrote Tuesday in a post on social platform X. We’ve spent years cracking down on fraudsters. It’s a serious issue…
title: Walz on frozen federal child care payments: ‘This is Trump’s long game’

author: Aaron Withe, opinion contributor
description: This year, my organization helped over 50,000 public employees across America exercise their First Amendment rights to opt out of union membership and dues. That single number represents something much bigger than a milestone for us. It means $47.5 million will stay in the pockets of the workers who earned it, rather than funding a political machine…
title: Public employee unions facing final showdown

author: Filip Timotija
description: The CIA’s recent drone strike on a Venezuelan port facility keeps President Trump’s options open in the country as he intensifies his pressure campaign, effectively expanding U.S. attacks onto land without committing the U.S. to an invasion of Venezuela. However, the commander in chief’s disclosure of the covert operations during a radio interview last week…
title: Trump’s CIA strike on Venezuela keeps options open, but carries risks
